comment.text: This translation key is used to display a success message when duplicating a folder. It appears as a toast notification in a UI, providing confirmation of a successful folder duplication operation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation maintains the same formatting tags (<2>{{title}}</2>) as the English content, which might be unnecessary or impact rendering depending on the context and system using the translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing or adjusting the tags if they are not required for the target platform/system. If the tags are necessary, ensure they are correctly interpreted by the receiving application.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'duplicated' is translated as 'ຜະລິດສຳເນົາ' which literally means 'produced a copy'. While technically correct, it's not the most natural way to convey 'duplicated' in Lao. A more accurate and natural translation might be something like 'ສຳເນົາຄືນ' (sam-nao khuen) which conveys 'copied back' or 'duplicated'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider replacing 'ຜະລິດສຳເນົາ' with 'ສຳເນົາຄືນ' or a similar phrase that more naturally conveys 'duplicated'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'replicated' (ප්‍රතිලියනය) in the Sinhala translation is too formal and not commonly used in this context. A more natural translation for 'duplicated' would be something like 'පිටපත් කරන ලදී' (pitapat karana ladi) or 'ප්‍රතිපත් කරන ලදී' (prathipat karana ladi).

The HTML tags `<2>` and `</2>` are not standard. They appear to be placeholders for a title, but this should be verified against the system using these tags. Assuming they're meant to be HTML tags, they don't correspond to a valid HTML tag. They are likely meant to be `<title>` and `</title>`, or `<name>` and `</name>` for example.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify the correct HTML tag format based on the system requirements. If meant to represent a title, consider `<title>{{title}}</title>`. If referring to a folder name, consider `<name>{{title}}</name>`.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'folder' is translated as 'фолдер'. While understandable, 'folder' is better translated as 'часовник' or 'папка' in Serbian (Cyrillic). 'Фолдер' is an Anglicism and might sound unnatural to some speakers.

The XML tags <2> and </2> appear to be present, but their purpose is unclear. It's likely intended to enclose the dynamic content title. It should be verified if this is the intended behavior and the tags are correct for the target platform/system.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify the purpose and correctness of the XML tags <2> and </2> with the development team or relevant documentation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets are correctly placed and preserved.

While technically correct, 'uspešno dupliran' (successfully duplicated) is a bit awkward in Serbian. A more natural phrasing would be 'uspešno kopiran' (successfully copied) or 'uspešno kreirana kopija' (a successful copy created).  'Dupliran' specifically implies a duplication process, which might not always be what's intended.

The angle brackets <2> and </2> are present in both the English and Ukrainian versions. While technically correct, they are unusual in UI text and may be better removed or replaced with a more standard format (e.g., using HTML tags or a dedicated variable).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the angle brackets or using a more conventional format for placeholders. For example, `<2>{{title}}</2>` could be `<2>{{title}}</2>` or simply `{{title}}` depending on the overall system.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'successfully duplicated' implies a copy was made of the folder. The Chinese translation '已成功创建副本' literally translates to 'successfully created a replica'. While similar, 'created a replica' can suggest a new creation rather than a duplication, which has a subtly different meaning in this context. '复制' (fu zhi) would be a more direct translation of 'duplicated'.
